singles.vanbancauhoi: Listen to the speaker talking on the radio. What is she talking about?
Listen to the conversation about the directions. Where is the library located?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: On the left of the square

singles.vanbancauhoi: Listen to the woman talking about her holiday plans. Where is she going next?
Listen to a writer talking about her job. What is her first job?
Listen to the conversation. Who is she taking a photo of?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: The boys’ and the girls’ team

singles.vanbancauhoi: Listen to the speaker talking about their weekly schedule. When is the meeting scheduled?
Listening to a man talking about his business trip. What does he like in Dubai?
Stephanie is looking for a job taking care of children. How old is she?
Listening to a woman’s announcement. Where will they wait for the bus?
Listen to a woman giving advice on saving money. What advice does she give to save money?
Listen to a teacher talking about meeting preparations. What is the teacher preparing for the meeting now?
Listen to an actor discussing his hobbies.What does the actor like to do in his free time?
Listen to a principal talking about new school facilities. What new facility will the school have?

multiples.title: Đề 10 - Listening c14
multiples.des: Four people are talking about Running. Complete the sentences below.

lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: The city gives me new things to see every time I run. I like the busy streets and different buildings around me. Stopping at traffic lights and watching out for people helps me stay alert. Running in the street is what I love most. I also get to find new places in my city this way. The hard ground makes my legs stronger. It can be a bit dangerous with cars, but that's what makes it exciting for me.

The clean air by the sea makes me feel good and helps clear my head. I enjoy feeling the sand under my feet, which helps make my legs stronger. The sound of the waves makes a nice beat for my run. There's nothing better than running by the seaside. Seeing the sun come up or go down while I run is really pretty. The cool wind from the sea keeps me from getting too hot. And after I'm done, I can jump in the water to cool off.

The track lets me know exactly how far I've run and helps me set goals. The smooth surface is better for my knees and ankles. There are no bumps or things in the way, so I can focus on how I run. For me, the running track is the best place to run. I can easily see how long each lap takes me. Having other runners around makes me want to try harder. I can run on the track in almost any weather, which is great.

Inside, I don't have to worry about it being too hot, cold, or rainy. I can use the treadmill and other machines to mix up my workout. The soft surface of the treadmill is easier on my knees than the road. I like running in the fitness center best. I can change how steep or fast the treadmill goes to make it more challenging. The machines tell me how fast my heart is beating and how well I'm doing. And when I'm done, I can take a shower and change right there.

multiples.title: Đề 10 - Listening C15
multiples.des: Listen to two people discussing changes in the workplace. Read the opinions below and decide whose opinion matches the statements, the man, the woman, or both the man and the woman. You can listen to the discussion twice.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Continuity is very important in the workplace. _
Job security cannot always be guaranteed. _
Job satisfaction is an important motivator. _
Technology is good for the entire economy. _
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Man: It seems like every workplace is going through so many changes lately. But honestly, I think Continuity is still very important. When things remain steady, it gives people a sense of security. If everything changes too fast, it’s hard for employees to keep up and the organization can lose its way. Continuity is important in keeping everyone focused.


Woman: I get where you're coming from, but I feel like these days, nothing is certain. Job security isn't something we can rely on anymore. There’s always the risk of layoffs, especially with the economy being unpredictable. People are moving from job to job more than ever before, and you can’t always count on staying in one place for long.


Man: That’s definitely a concern. But regardless of job security or stability, one thing we both can agree on is that job satisfaction is a huge motivator. When people love what they do, they’re more likely to stay, even when times get tough. It’s the main reason many of us keep pushing through the challenges.


Woman: Absolutely! I think when people are satisfied with their work, they’re willing to go the extra mile. It’s not just about the paycheck; it’s about feeling fulfilled. That’s what really makes the difference in the workplace.


Man: You’re right. And another thing that’s making a difference is technology. It’s been a game-changer for the economy, making things faster and more efficient. The growth we’ve seen in so many industries is because of how we’ve embraced new technologies. It’s definitely helping businesses thrive.

multiples.title: Đề 10 - Listening C16
multiples.des: Listen to an expert talk about how to manage personal finances and answer the questions below.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: How does the speaker recommend saving money effectively?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Saving a large amount only on a daily basis.
Use credit cards to manage expenses

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Who does the speaker believe can save money most successfully?
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Good afternoon, everyone! Today, I want to share a few simple tips on how you can manage your personal finances better. Now, I know that saving money can sometimes feel challenging, but there are a few habits that can make it easier. One of the best ways to save effectively is to set aside a fixed amount every month. I recommend you make this a habit. You can even automate it by setting up a transfer from your checking account to your savings account. This way, the money is put aside before you even get a chance to spend it. If you just wait until the end of the month to save whatever is left over, there’s a good chance there won’t be much left—especially with all the small, unexpected expenses that pop up. So, it’s all about making saving a priority and keeping it consistent.

Now, when it comes to managing your finances overall, one key piece of advice is to get help from people who know more than you. That could mean speaking with a financial advisor if you’re able, but it could also mean getting advice from someone in your life who’s really good with money—whether that’s a friend, a family member, or even an online resource. You don’t have to figure everything out on your own. Learning from others can save you time and help you avoid costly mistakes, especially if you're new to budgeting or long-term planning.

Remember, managing money doesn’t have to be complicated. By saving regularly and learning from others, you can start to feel more confident about your finances."

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Get advice from people that have experience
Keep all your savings in a single account
Avoid making any long-term financial plans

multiples.title: Đề 10- Listening C17
multiples.des: Listen to a woman talk about security camera and answer the questions below.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What is the speaker’s opinion about security cameras at work?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: People are unnecessarily worried about them
Most people don't even realize cameras are present.
Cameras should be placed to ensure complete coverage.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: How does the speaker suggest people should feel about security cameras at work?
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
I've noticed that some of my coworkers get a bit nervous about the security cameras in our office. They often say things like, 'It feels like we're being watched all the time,' or 'I don't like feeling like I'm not trusted.' But honestly, I think people worry too much about it. These cameras aren't there to spy on us or catch us doing something wrong. They're actually there to keep us safe. I mean, think about it - if something were to happen, like a theft or an accident, wouldn't you want there to be a record of it?


Plus, knowing the cameras are there can actually prevent bad things from happening in the first place. I believe that once people understand the real purpose of these cameras, they'll feel much better about them. Instead of feeling worried, we should feel glad that our company cares about our safety. It's just one more way they're looking out for us while we're at work.


You know, I remember when we first got the cameras installed. Some people were really upset about it. But after a while, most of us hardly even notice them anymore. They're just part of the background now. And there have been times when they've been really helpful. Like when someone's bag went missing, the cameras helped us figure out what happened.


I think it's important to remember that these cameras are in public areas, not in private spaces like bathrooms or changing rooms. They're not meant to invade our privacy, just to make sure everyone follows the rules and stays safe. In the end, I think having them makes our workplace better for everyone. It's a small thing that can make a big difference in keeping us all secure

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: People often find them intimidating and invasive.
Many believe they are only useful after incidents have occurred.
People should feel reassured about their presence

readings.title: Đề 10 - Reading p3
readings.des: The sentences below are from some directions. Put the sentences in the right order. The first sentence is done for you.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
How to plant your rose trees

To plant roses effectively, follow these steps

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: In the chosen place, dig a deep hole in the ground
Put the base of the rose and cover the root with lease earth
Push this down by hand until the tree is straight
Once you planted it, water them everyday
The amount of water depends on the weather condition

readings.title: Đề 10 - Reading p1
readings.des:
Choose one word from the list for each gap. The first one is done for you 

Dear Mum and Dad, 

I have just (bought/ brought/drawn) a new car
readings.des_cuoi:
Hope you have a good day!

Tracy

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: I am never _ to work and I get to work at 9am
In the morning, I attend the _ in the office
I eat lunch in the _ near my work
After works, I buy food in a _.
I always _ a good dinner for myself

readings.title: Đề 10 - Reading p2
readings.des: The sentences below are from a biography. Order the sentences to make a story. The first sentence of the story is an example.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
Early life of Jay Mist

0. Jay mist is a famous American actor but his parents come from India.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: When he was young, his parent left their country and moved to the United States
He started his high school and began strength training in his free time
Jay was really good at it and entered some body building competitions
At one of these events, an acting agent saw him and gave him a starring role
It was a big action company so he became successful quickly

readings.title: Đề 10 - Reading p5
readings.des:
Read the text. Match the headings to the paragraphs. There is one heading that you will not use.

The benefits of learning instruments

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
1._

Research indicates that children who play an instrument experience various positive effects. They become more engaged in school, leading to improved academic performance, especially in comprehension and math. Learning to play music also enhances their fine and gross motor skills and coordination. It can positively impact mental health and well-being and help with memory and social interactions. Moreover, playing an instrument fosters a sense of accomplishment, boosts confidence, and allows for self-expression in children. These benefits make learning music a wonderful experience for your child.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: A great opportunity to broaden social circle
A creative outlet of expressing emotions
A good way to boost memory
A way to learn discipline and importance of routine
Organize their time effectively to learn

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
2._

Learning and playing music has been linked to enhanced memory function. Memorizing sheet music, chords, and melodies exercises the brain, improving memory and cognitive abilities. The process of learning new pieces and practicing them regularly helps strengthen neural connections, leading to improved memory retention and recall in other areas of life as well.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: A great opportunity to broaden social circle
A creative outlet of expressing emotions
A good way to boost memory
A way to learn discipline and importance of routine
Organize their time effectively to learn

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
3._

Playing an instrument isn’t only good for your brain, it’s also a fantastic opportunity to connect with other like-minded individuals. Joining a band, orchestra, or music group allows musicians to collaborate, share experiences, and develop friendships. Music also has a universal language, making it easier to communicate and connect with people from diverse backgrounds and cultures.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: A great opportunity to broaden social circle
A creative outlet of expressing emotions
A good way to boost memory
A way to learn discipline and importance of routine
Organize their time effectively to learn

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
4._

Unless you’re an out-of-this-world child prodigy, learning to play an instrument isn’t a skill you can master overnight. Learning music takes time and effort, and helps children understand that if they want to be good at something, they’ll need to put in the hours and organize their time effectively. This disciplined approach fosters a strong work ethic, patience, and perseverance that can be applied to other areas of life.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: A great opportunity to broaden social circle
A creative outlet of expressing emotions
A good way to boost memory
A way to learn discipline and importance of routine
Organize their time effectively to learn

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
5._

Music serves as a channel for individuals to express themselves and communicate in special ways. When kids learn to play an instrument, they can explore their inner world and share thoughts uniquely, even when they struggle to do so verbally. Additionally, playing music can be a form of stress relief. The act of playing an instrument requires concentration and focus, which can help children relax and unwind. It can also provide a healthy way to channel their emotions and energy.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: A great opportunity to broaden social circle
A creative outlet of expressing emotions
A good way to boost memory
A way to learn discipline and importance of routine
Organize their time effectively to learn

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
6._

Being a musician in a five-minute song requires physical and mental involvement, but emotional connection is even more crucial. It's not just about the music's mood but also our own feelings. Music develops focus, which helps in life. Research shows that music education improves emotional intelligence, understanding our emotions and others'. Musicians learn to listen and cooperate with others, being attentive and adaptable. This fosters better appreciation of others' emotions and viewpoints.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: A great opportunity to broaden social circle
A creative outlet of expressing emotions
A good way to boost memory
A way to learn discipline and importance of routine
Organize their time effectively to learn

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
7._

Playing a musical instrument has been shown to help mental health by reducing stress, anxiety and depression. It requires all of your attention allowing you an escape from day-to-day stresses and creates a feeling of mindfulness and calm. Music releases dopamine, the feel-good chemical in the brain, so playing an instrument makes people happy! Factor in the sense of achievement you'll feel when you learn a new note or master a piece and you'll never have felt better.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: A great opportunity to broaden social circle
A creative outlet of expressing emotions
A good way to boost memory
A way to learn discipline and importance of routine
Organize their time effectively to learn

readings.title: Đề 10 - Reading p4
readings.des:
Four people respond in the comments section of an online newspaper about their last holiday. Read their comments and answer the questions below.

Ali

I went to this island to visit some remote beaches. I thought walking shoes would be helpful. However, when I arrived, I realized that I had forgotten to bring them. The remoteness means there are no other visitors. It is good, but it has its downside. There is nowhere to buy food and drink, so I have to bring my own.

Bruno

Being an architect, when I go abroad, I am very curious about the construction of local buildings. I often lay down at the beach and buy some souvenirs at the local shop. This time, I traveled by taxi to go around. There is no one to share so the cost is high. However, it’s worth it because I could see some beautiful traditional houses.

Carla

The sharp bends of the island look dangerous and that put me off hiring a car, especially when it is costly. Therefore, I chose to travel by bus. However, the bus service is not very frequent. If they improve it, it would be perfect. I visit some famous places near my hotel on foot. I love it because I can see many beautiful locations.

Deniz

I stayed in a village and ate at various local restaurants. I cannot recommend a specific dish because everything was amazing. However, if you want to cook by yourself, you would need to take a bus to the town. There is a street market where you can buy some local products. I had some real bargains there.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Who forgot something to bring?_
Who thinks public transport should be improved?_
Who liked the food?_
Who paid a lot of money on transport?_
Who liked walking?_
Who liked to buy things made on the island?_
Who liked being alone?_

speakings.title: Đề 10 - Speaking p1
speakings.des:
In this part, I am going to ask you three short questions about yourself and your interests. You will have 30 seconds to reply to each question.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What is the best way to travel in your country?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: 

In Vietnam the best way to get around ( = travel) in the country is traveling by train.

Traveling by train is so cheap and convenient that everyone can afford ( = pay) a ticket.

Besides, when we travel by train, we can have more time to enjoy the beautiful scenery from the window. 

If we travel from the north to the south of Vietnam, we can have the chance to sightsee many beautiful places along the route.
Version 2: 

Let me tell you about the best way to travel around your country

First, it is travelling by bus because it is cheap and convenient.

Second, it is by train because it is fast and time-saving.

For me, I often travel by train because it saves a lot of money.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What do people in your country like to read?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: 

People in my country like to read newspapers.

In Vietnam, it is easy to see many newspaper stores on the streets selling traditional newspapers.

Besides, with mobile phones, Vietnamese people now often read news on the Internet when they have free time such as while traveling by bus to work or drinking coffee at a coffee shop.
Version 2: 

let me tell you about what people in my country like to read

First, people like reading online newspaper . People can use their smartphone to read.

It helps to save money and time. Besides, it is a good way to expand people’s social knowledge. 

this is my answer

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe your journey here today.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: 

Today I traveled to the exam room by car because it is in Cau Giay district which is quite far from my house. 

It takes me 1 hour to travel from home to there by car. 

Traffic in Hanoi was always congested and made me tired. 

Luckily, I was not late for the exam, so I am very happy now.
Version 2: 

let me tell you about my journey here

I went here by motorcycle with my friends , it takes me 1 hour to go here

The exam room is in Cau Giay street, very near my house 

Thanks to that i could went the exam room faster so i will try my best to pass

speakings.title: Đề 10 - Speaking p3
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to ask you to compare two pictures, and I will then ask you two questions about them. You will have 45 seconds for each response.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe 2 pictures
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Both pictures show how people enjoy music.

In the first picture, a singer is performing live in front of thousands of audience members. In the second picture, a man is listening to music alone in his living room.

The first picture represents listening to music in a public setting, while the second shows a more private experience.

I imagine that everyone in both scenes is feeling excited. Personally, I prefer the first picture because I enjoy the lively, energetic atmosphere.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Which one do you prefer?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Each situation has its own attractions, but as I have mentioned before, I prefer the first picture because … / which is more crowded and exciting. I enjoy this vibrant atmosphere. Besides, it is a wonderful way for me to make new friends who have the same hobby in this public setting. As a result, I can broaden my social knowledge and gain more experience. 

For example, last summer, I went to the concert of My Tam singer/ My Tam’s concert. Thanks to that , I could make a lot of friends.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What are the benefits of listening to music?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
• There are several benefits of listening to music 
  • It’s refreshing because people can easily concentrate on work and increase my productivity 
  • It’s extremely useful because it helps people broaden knowledge about culture around the world( skills) 
  • For example, when I listen to pop music, I can not only broaden my knowledge about the culture of America and Western countries but also refresh my mind after stressful days of studying.

speakings.title: Đề 10 - Speaking p2
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to ask you to describe a picture. Then I will ask you two questions about it. You will have 45 seconds for each response.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe this picture
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
In this picture, I can see a woman, two kids and a man in the car

In the background, I can't see anything because it is so blurry

In the front, while the young woman is wearing a blue shirt, babies and the man is wearing a grey and pink T-shirts

It is clear that the man is driving and the other people are sitting in the car. All of them are happily looking at the camera

I guess that they are headed to the beach or on a long holiday

To be honest, the picture is so beautiful that it might have been taken by a professional.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Tell about a time when you went somewhere in a car
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: Last year, I went to the beach by car ( how)  with my family ( who) . It was so comfortable because I had an interesting conversation with everyone during the car ride ( why). We had a great holiday at  ( what/ where) Nha Trang beach, which was one of the most famous tourist destinations in Hanoi. Well, the trip was so memorable because it was a wonderful way to refresh my mind after a stressful day of work.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Do you think people should learn to drive? Why and why not?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: It is the fact that learning to drive plays an important role in our life. I agree with this because of several reasons. First, thanks to driving, people are able to  travel without relying on public transportation or others. Second, learning to drive is a wonderful way to relax and reduce stress after hard-working days. Finally, people should learn to drive because they can save money spent on public transport.

speakings.title: Đề 10 - Speaking p4
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to show you a picture and ask you three questions. You will have one minute to think about your answers before you start speaking. You will have two minutes to answer all three questions.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound. Look at the photograph.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
Tell me about a time you read a good book

How do you feel when you read a book for pleasure?

Some people love watching films more than reading books. What do you think?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Today, I am going to tell you about a time I read a good book. 

What: It is a book named” Tips for traveling to Danang”, which is one of the most interesting books in Vietnam. Well, Danang is a coastal city in central Vietnam. It is a one-hour flight from Hanoi. Da nang is famous for its beaches, and for example one of them is My Khe, which is one of the most wonderful beaches in the world, so every year, there are thousands of tourists going to the area to see the beauty of the beach.  

I read this book when I was finding a way to relax after many exams. 

I really like this book because thanks to it, I can broaden my knowledge about Danang in particular and travelling in general. After that, I decided to take a trip to Danang 

Regarding the second question/ my emotions when I read a book for pleasure, I would say I am so relaxed. 

As for the final question, Some people love watching films more than reading books. I agree with this because people find watching films more interesting because they can see attractive images and sound effects. 

That’s my opinion. Thank you for your listening.

writings.title: Đề 10 - Writing p1
writings.des: You want to join the Science club. You have 5 messages from a member of the club. Write short answers (1–5 words) to each message. Recommended time: 3 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What is your job?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: I am a teacher/ I am a doctor.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Where did you go last night?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: I went to school/ the hospital/ the park.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What is your favorite color?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: It is red./ It is green.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What do you like to do in the evening?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: I like playing games. ( like + to V/ V-ing) / I like watching TV.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What is the weather like today?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: It’s hot./ It’s cold/ rainy/ windy.

writings.title: Đề 10 - Writing p2
writings.des: You want to join the Science club. Fill in the form. Write in sentences. Use 20 – 30 words. Recommended time: 7 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: When and where do you usually read science books?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: I usually read science books when I have free time, for example on weekends. Besides, I often read books with my friends at home or in the library because it allows me to relax and reduce stress after a long day at work.

writings.title: Đề 10 - Writing p3
writings.des: You are communicating with other members of the club in the chat room. Reply to their questions. Write in sentences. Use 30–40 words per answer. Recommended time: 10 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: A: I have been interested in science since I was a child because I was lucky when I had a wonderful teacher. How about you? What do you remember about studying science at school?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
since: từ khi 
wonderful : tuyệt vời 
How about you?: còn bạn thì sao 
I have also been keen on ( = interested in) learning about science since I was a kid. Actually, at that time, I studied science with my friends 3 times a week at school. In addition, I felt very interested  because my teacher told me a lot of interesting stories about science.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: B: my friends like watching scientific programmes while I prefer to read science books. How about you? Which do you prefer to do?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
Cách 1: prefer to read read science books - many reasons ( relax and reduce + improve creativity=> happy and comfortable ) 
Cách 2 : prefer to watch scientific programmes ( improve imagination and communication + refresh my mind )
Bài mẫu: In my opinion, I prefer to read science books for many reasons.
First, it helps me relax and reduce stress after a long day at work. Second, it is a good way to expand my social knowledge and gain more experience.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: C: Some people think technology has a negative effect on our lives. What do you think?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
negative : tiêu cực >< positive xss=removed> tác hại >< Disagree> lợi ích 
In my opinion, I disagree that technology has a negative effect on our lives for many reasons. 
First, technology helps people to do everything fast and conveniently.
Second, it is a good way to relax and reduce stress after a long day at work. 
Finally, people feel fun and comfortable about using technology.

writings.title: Đề 10 - Writing p4
writings.des:
You are a member of the Science club. You received this email from the club’s manager.
Dear member, 
Next month, our club will hold a science exhibition for the public in our local area. What kinds of things do you think we should include? How can we encourage both adults and children to come in? Should we charge an entry fee or give customers for free?

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Write an e-mail to your friend. Write about your feelings and what you are planning to do. Write 50 words.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
Dear Linda,
How are things?
Did you receive the email from the club? 
I am very happy to hear that news. 
I suppose ( = think) we should include different kinds of paintings and toys because children will be interested in them . Besides, I think we should tell adults and children about the benefits of science to encourage them to come to our event.
What do you think about this?
Yours,

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Write an e-mail to the manager of the club. Write about your feelings and what you would like to do. Write 120-150 words.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
Dear Sir,
My name is Van. I have been a member of our club for 2 months. 
I am writing in response to your latest email. 
According to the email, our club will hold a science exhibition for the public in our local area. 
To be honest, I am very delighted ( = happy) to hear that news. 
I would love to venture ( = express) my idea. In my opinion, regarding ( về) + V-ing/N  what kinds of things we should include in the event, it is advisable for us to use different kinds of painting and toys because children will be interested in them. About the ways we encourage both adults and children to come in, I think we should tell adults and children about the benefits of science, for example, it is a wonderful way to broaden their social knowledge and gain more experience.
